review_title: Always a name, never a number
pros: Working at City of Bristol College, you are made to feel valued. Staff are supportive, kind and always smiling and equality and diversity is celebrated. Here it is okay to be different and have your own style or flair and every day is different and enjoyable.
cons: None to note at this time.

review_title: All the intentions, but lacked the infrastructure
pros: A lot of passion A lot of powerful intentions Some excellent resources for the learners
cons: Far too much bureaucracy "Too many cooks" Lacks a student focused attitude Some severe undertones of discriminatory attitudes towards students and staff

pros: Central location and some flexibility
cons: Business wide funding difficulties in the past

pros:

Flexible hours 
Holidays
cons: Pay not great for support staff

review_title: Very flexible but can be very frustrating.

pros:

pros: - genuinely good people who want to make a difference

pros: good people, all wanting to improve the business.
cons: lack of people resources in the right areas to make the improvements needed

job_title: Head of Marketing in Bristol, England
pros: City of Bristol College offers a superb range of courses at all levels. The facilities for students are very impressive and having worked at a number of colleges, I can say that they are some of the best I have seen. The working and learning environment is bright and vibrant. Despite Covid restrictions my induction, orientation and meeting of new colleagues was very well organised and made easier by great IT facilities that I was provided with, and have access to. The initial training is well managed through an online portal and the HR team and managers are readily available to provide support and guidance. A great College in a great City!
cons: None to report at this time

pros: High level of equality and respect towards all staff and students. The organisation actively supports employees to progress and take courses and training. Very positive and healthy working culture. Also very supportive of personal and family life needs and is very flexible and accommodating.
cons: Limited funding so salaries are not the best

review_title: A College with a Vision & great staff
job_title: Director of Human Resources in Bristol, England
pros:
The staff across the board are brilliantly dedicated to delivering for students and putting student needs at the forefront of everything they do.
A vibrant working environment with a student body that is enthusiastic about learning.
cons: The traffic in and around Bristol can be horrendous

review_title: Friendly staff, easy job, and good hours
pros: Easy way of earning money
cons: I experienced no cons at all

job_title: Learning Support Assistant in Bristol, England
pros: Term time only contract. Excellent home work balance
cons: Can be stressful at times

pros: Friendly students and staff here
cons: No Cons at this place

pros: Lovely team of colleagues. Convenient locations in the city.
cons: HR team unsupportive and not well trained.

review_title: Should be closed down by Ofsted
pros: I honestly cannot think of any
cons: No work life balance as a Manager for a Project I was doing 3 full time jobs - the SMT had reduced my Team from 11 to 4 with Redundancies.  My line Manager has no Managerial experience and caused so much upset within the Team that I had to resigned after 16 years continuous service due to ill health,  this was forced on me.  I kept asking for assistance with an under performing staff member who is still employed (they like underperforming staff) and the performing staff member has also now left.  What a joke of a Company.  They have no money, selling off all their property to pay underperforming people.

review_title: A business that has lost it's way
pros: The staff want to succeed and do all in their power to give the students the best journey that they can.
cons: Staff are bullied into providing more effort for no improvement in wages. The constant pressure of redundancies being threatened although the fault lies with the poor management by the senior managers

review_title: Great colleagues and variety of courses to be involved with delivering
pros: College Green is a great central location. New principal seems set to support future of the college.  Colleagues are friendly and dedicated.
cons: No wage increase and continual redundancies which have impacted widely on staff morale. Very few perks or rewards for staff.

review_title: Poorly supported, demotivated staff and emphasis on saving money rather than student of staff satisfaction
pros: Some great (and often very stressed) employees
cons: Constant pressure to 'perform' according to finance-led guidelines. Staff reduction resulting in increased workload and pressure for remaining staff.

pros: The students were enthusiastic and I had some great colleagues who made it worthwhile teaching there especially before my autonomy was eroded.
cons: Dreadfully incompetent 'senior' management. New contracts were enforced without agreement from teaching staff with the connivance of useless trade unions.

pros: The porters, front of house and exams team are friendly and professional. Ben Davison, of Organisational Development, is the company’s key asset.
cons: Unsupportive management, discriminatory Human Resources partners and very disability-unfriendly and constant redundancies in the 6 years I’ve been here.

job_title: Graduate Teaching Assistant in Bristol, England
pros: School holidays  are free
cons: Wages are low because of holidays

pros: Great colleagues. Worked there for 5 years
cons: No support from management, awful blame culture, no help even when requested. Total mess with an ever revolving staff door. People not qualified for their job roles - total shambles.

pros: A large employer, potential for advancement in different areas
cons: Terrible management with a blame culture.  Some very badly supervised staff therefore teamwork becomes toxic
